memberdef.definition: typedef bool(DispersalCoordinator::* DispersalCoordinator::end_fptr) (const unsigned long &density, long &oldx, long &oldy, long &oldxwrap, long &oldywrap, const long &startx, const long &starty, const long &startxwrap, const long &startywrap)
memberdef.argsstring: )(const unsigned long &density, long &oldx, long &oldy, long &oldxwrap, long &oldywrap, const long &startx, const long &starty, const long &startxwrap, const long &startywrap)
memberdef.name: end_fptr

briefdescription.para: Sets the random number pointer to an NRrand instance.

parameterdescription.para: the random number object to set to

briefdescription.para: Sets the pointer to the Landscape object.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the reproduction probability map

briefdescription.para: Sets the pointer to the Landscape object.
Sets the generation pointer to the provided double.

memberdef.argsstring: (const string &dispersal_method, const string &dispersal_file, const unsigned long &dispersal_x, const unsigned long &dispersal_y, const double &m_probin, const double &cutoffin, const double &sigmain, const double &tauin, const bool &restrict_self)
memberdef.name: setDispersal

briefdescription.para: Sets the dispersal method and parameters.

parameterdescription.para: string containing the dispersal type. Can be one of [normal, fat-tail, norm-uniform]
string containing the dispersal file, or "none" if using dispersal kernel
the x dimensions of the dispersal file
the y dimensions of the dispersal file
the probability of drawing from the uniform distribution. Only relevant for uniform dispersals
the maximum value to be drawn from the uniform dispersal. Only relevant for uniform dispersals
the fatness of the fat-tailed dispersal kernel
the width of the fat-tailed dispersal kernel
if true, denies possibility that dispersal comes from the same cell as the parent

briefdescription.para: Sets the dispersal parameters from the SimParameters object.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the simulation parameters to set

briefdescription.para: Imports the dispersal map and fixes the values based on the density and reproduction probabilities.

parameterdescription.para: pointer x and y dimension of the dispersal map

briefdescription.para: Saves the raw dispersal data to another memory object to save reading from disk multiple times later on. This is slightly more RAM intensive which may cause issues for certain simulations.
Adds the density values to the dispersal map.
Adds the reproduction rates to the dispersal map.
Fixes the dispersal map by generating cumulative probability distributions across each row.
Sums probabilities across the given row and divides by the total probability, so that the cumulative probabilities sum to one.

parameterdescription.para: the row index to check over

briefdescription.para: Checks if the provided row index requires re-scaling to a cumulative probability in the dispersal map.

simplesect.para: true if re-scaling of the row is required

briefdescription.para: Ensures that the dispersal map makes sense given the density.
Checks that the dispersal map makes sense with dispersal to and from only cells which have a non-zero density.
Updates the dispersal map, if there is one, to reflect changes in landscape density.
Picks a random cell from the whole map and stores the value in the step object.

parameterdescription.para: the step object to store end points in

briefdescription.para: Picks a random dispersal distance from the dispersal map.

parameterdescription.para: the step object to store end points in

briefdescription.para: Calculates the new coordinates for a column reference. This includes converting between the fine map and sample map. New coordinates are saved in this_step.

parameterdescription.para: the step to save new coordinates in.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the cell reference for a particular coordinate.

detaileddescription.para: The formula for this calculation is x + (y * xdim) where xdim is the x dimension of the fine map, and x and y are the coordinates for the fine map

parameterdescription.para: the step object containing the x, y location, and x,y wrapping

simplesect.para: the cell reference from the dispersal_prob_map which corresponds to the required cell

briefdescription.para: Calls the dispersal kernel from the supplied dispersal distribution.

parameterdescription.para: the step object to store end points in

briefdescription.para: Sets the end point function pointer correctly, based on whether it is restricted or not.

parameterdescription.para: if true, denies possibility that dispersal comes from the same cell as the parent

memberdef.argsstring: (const unsigned long &density, long &oldx, long &oldy, long &oldxwrap, long &oldywrap, const long &startx, const long &starty, const long &startxwrap, const long &startywrap)
memberdef.name: checkEndPoint

briefdescription.para: Check the end point for the given coordinates and density.

parameterdescription.para: the density at the end point - avoids an extra call to Map::getVal()

simplesect.para: true if the end point passes the density and restricted checks

memberdef.argsstring: (const unsigned long &density, long &oldx, long &oldy, long &oldxwrap, long &oldywrap, const long &startx, const long &starty, const long &startxwrap, const long &startywrap)

briefdescription.para: Performs the dispersal routine using the Step object to read starting positions and record the end positions.

parameterdescription.para: the Step object for reading starting position and storing output distances and angles

briefdescription.para: Class for generating dispersal distances and provide routines for reading dispersal distance maps as a unwound map-of-maps. This class also handles reading density maps for rejection sampling.

detaileddescription.para: It requires linking to a density map, random number generator and a generation counter from the Tree class.
Note that no element of this object is recorded during a paused simulation, as all objects pointed to are stored elsewhere and behaviours are recalculated upon simulation resume.
